FuncDef:
The tunnel-policy nonexistent-config-check command controls whether the system allows a nonexistent tunnel policy to be specified in a command.
The undo tunnel-policy nonexistent-config-check disable command forbids a nonexistent tunnel policy to be specified in a command.
By default, the system does not allow a nonexistent tunnel policy to be specified in a command.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the system does not allow a nonexistent tunnel policy to be specified in a command.
-

Indicates that the system allows a nonexistent tunnel policy to be specified in a command.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, if you specify a nonexistent tunnel policy in a command, the command does not take effect. To enable the system to allow a nonexistent tunnel policy to be specified in a command, run the tunnel-policy nonexistent-config-check disable command.
